intro: Taraxacum longiconicum, commonly known as the long-stemmed dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the dandelion family, Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright, hairy stems and large, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant produces a distinctive, fluffy seed head that disperses seeds via the wind. It thrives in a variety of soil types and is often found in meadows, lawns, and disturbed areas. Taraxacum longiconicum is a perennial plant that is widely distributed across Europe and parts of Asia.
